titleproper.value: Guide to the Stuart Sherman Papers<lb/><date>1945-2001 (Bulk 1961-2001)</date><lb/> <num>MSS 192</num>

author.value: Collection processed by Luke Martin and Brent Phillips, 2008-2009

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-08-29T13:03:52</date>

extent.value: in 21 record cartons, 2 half manuscript boxes, 3 box binders, 1 LP box, 1 flat box, 63 jewel cases, and 1 shared card box.

abstract.value: The Stuart Sherman Papers include material pertaining to his career as a performance and visual artist, poet, actor, and filmmaker. The collection is largely composed of material related to Sherman's artistic output including performance plans, prose and poetry, sketches and diagrams for visual and performance works, drafts for sculpture, photographs, slides, video, film, audio, and floppy disks. Personal material such as correspondence, journal writing, legal and financial documents along with works by fellow artists and writers also make up a large portion of the collection. The material spans from 1945-2001 with the bulk of it covering from 1961-2001.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Stuart Sherman Papers; MSS 192; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.
Donated by Mark Bradford, executor of Stuart Sherman's Estate, in 2007. The accession number associated with this gift is 2007.192.

This series consists of personal items and documents including correspondence, resumes, and various material for psychological/spiritual healing.

Financial - Receipts, Bank info., etc.N/A213Financial - Bank account registers - 1/28/98-12/16/98; 4/30/97-8/17/99; 8/18/99-5/9/001997-2000214Legal - Will, Bankruptcy files, NYPL donation acknowledgements etc.N/A215Apartment Leases1974-2001216Tax Returns1993-2000217Series III: Prose, Poetry, and Other WritingScope and Contents note

This series includes prose, poetry, reviews, and other creative writing by Stuart Sherman from his teenage years up until his death.

Arrangement

The material has been ordered chronologically in groups respective of the arrangement as received: Juvenilia; Notes and Poetry; Reviews and Prose; Poetry; and Diagram Poetry. Although attempts were made to isolate these groups within this series, researchers may find Sherman's poetry and prose mixed throughout the collection. For example, poetry may be found in address books, in notebooks titled prose writing, alongside performance planning, or in other places.

Press1983-1997473Series V: Works by OthersScope and Contents note

This series consists of works by artists and writers other than Stuart Sherman which were included in his personal archive. Artworks, books, academic/professional journals, exhibition catalogs, and other miscellaneous items may be found in this series. Some publications include contributions by or about Stuart Sherman.

This series includes drawings, sketches, drafts for sculpture, collage, and other artworks. Sixty-nine original drafts (Folders 120 and 121) were treated for mold damage and have been housed separately (Box 5B). Several works had post-it annotations attached, which have been photocopied and removed. The photocopies are housed next to the corresponding draft.

This series contains includes two binders of slides documenting Sherman's artistic output. Some slides include detailed identifying information.

Arrangement

The original order of slides has been preserved, though no obvious rule of arrangement appears to have existed.

Slides - Misc. Performance, Exhibit, etc.undated7 (slide binder) 24 sleeves Slides - Misc. Performance, Exhibit, etc.undated8 (slide binder) 21 sleeves Series IX: Video63 videodiscs (dvd)Scope and Contents

This series contains contains all videotaped material by or pertaining to Stuart Sherman.

Arrangement

The materials are arranged into three subseries. Paper material which was found within original video containers may be found in Subseries C. The subseries are labeled as follows:

Subseries A: Video - Access Copies

Subseries B: Video - Originals

Subseries C: Video - Paper Material

Conditions Governing Access

Of the media portion, researcher access is limited to Subseries A: Video Recordings – Access Copies. Repository permission is required for access. Please contact Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu, (212) 998-2596.

Subseries A: Video Recordings - Access CopiesConditions Governing Access

Access copies for some materials are available by appointment for reading room viewing and listening only. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.

This series contains all objects.
